abstract: The admission, involving the scanning of Wi-Fi networks to improve its mapping products, contradicts the company’s previous claims.
snippet: The admission, involving the scanning of Wi-Fi networks to improve its mapping products, contradicts the company’s previous claims.
lead_paragraph: On Friday, Google made a stunning admission: for over three years, it has inadvertently collected snippets of private information that people send over unencrypted wireless networks.

headline.main: Google Says It Inadvertently Collected Personal Data
